docs.lead_paragraph: Revere America, a conservative advocacy group dedicated to repealing the health care law enacted earlier this year, announced on Wednesday that it is undertaking a multi-million-dollar television advertising campaign aimed at ousting Democrats in Congress who supported the law. The ad campaign was announced by former Gov. George E. Pataki of New York, a Republican who is now serving as chairman of Revere America. At a news conference at the National Press Club in Washington on Wednesday, Mr. Pataki said the group hoped to raise and spend at least $5 million on the effort by Election Day.
